info.name: Payment API
info.description: The Payment API is an API collection, the payment API allows integrators to POST specified requests to complete various transactional operations within the Payment Gateway. The Payment API method is the simplest integration method for both web-based and non web-based payment applications.

item.name: Payment Types

urlencoded.description:
The type of transaction to be processed.
Values: 'sale', 'auth', 'credit', 'validate', or 'offline'
The tokenized version of the customer's card or check information. This will be generated by Collect.js and is usable only once.

Total amount to be charged. For validate, the amount must be omitted or set to 0.00.
Format: x.xx

Card billing country.
Country codes are as shown in ISO 3166. Format: CC

request.description: The transaction type Sale performs both an authorization and a capture of an authorized amount for a transaction. This transaction type will perform a full start to end transaction within a single request, unlike utilizing an Auth and Capture method for transactions.

urlencoded.description:
The type of transaction to be processed.
Values: 'sale', 'auth', 'credit', 'validate', or 'offline'
The tokenized version of the customer's card or check information. This will be generated by Collect.js and is usable only once.

Total amount to be charged. For validate, the amount must be omitted or set to 0.00.
Format: x.xx

Card billing country.
Country codes are as shown in ISO 3166. Format: CC

The type of transaction to be processed.
Values: 'sale', 'auth', 'credit', 'validate', or 'offline'
The tokenized version of the customer's card or check information. This will be generated by Collect.js and is usable only once.

Total amount to be charged. For validate, the amount must be omitted or set to 0.00.
Format: x.xx

Card billing country.
Country codes are as shown in ISO 3166. Format: CC

The type of transaction to be processed.
Values: 'sale', 'auth', 'credit', 'validate', or 'offline'
The tokenized version of the customer's card or check information. This will be generated by Collect.js and is usable only once.

Total amount to be charged. For validate, the amount must be omitted or set to 0.00.
Format: x.xx

Card billing country.
Country codes are as shown in ISO 3166. Format: CC

request.description: The transaction type Auth or Authorization provides an approval from a credit card issuer that states the cardholder has sufficient funds available to cover the cost of the transaction being performed. This transaction type requires an additional capture transaction upon successful completion of the Auth transaction.

urlencoded.description:
The type of transaction to be processed.
Values: 'sale', 'auth', 'credit', 'validate', or 'offline'

Total amount to be settled. This amount must be equal to or less than the original authorized amount.
Format: x.xx

request.description: The transaction type Capture is used upon a successful completion of an Auth transaction. The Capture transaction is used to specify to request that the authorized funds be sent over from the cardholder's issuing bank.

urlencoded.description:
The type of transaction to be processed.
Values: 'sale', 'auth', 'credit', 'validate', or 'offline'

Total amount to be settled. This amount must be equal to or less than the original authorized amount.
Format: x.xx

The type of transaction to be processed.
Values: 'sale', 'auth', 'credit', 'validate', or 'offline'
The tokenized version of the customer's card or check information. This will be generated by Collect.js and is usable only once.

Total amount to be credited.
Format: x.xx

Card billing country.
Country codes are as shown in ISO 3166. Format: CC

request.description: The Credit transaction type is used for sending funds to a specified cardholder. A Credit transaction will send funds from the Merchants issuing bank. Credits use cases vary, but are commonly used as a method of funding/ refunding when there is no previous transaction committed or Merchants are unable to locate a previous transaction id.

item.description: The Payment API allows integrators to utilize various different Payment Types in order to perform different transaction processes. These processes differ and are utilized for different scenarios and purposes. The following section will share further examples of how to utilize the sale, auth, capture, refund and credit payment types within the Payment API.

item.name: Payment Source Examples

urlencoded.description:
The type of transaction to be processed.
Values: 'sale', 'auth', 'credit', or 'validate'

Total amount to be charged. For validate, the amount must be omitted or set to 0.00.
Format: x.xx
The card security code. While this is not required, it is strongly recommended.

Credit card expiration date.
Format: MMYY
The name on the customer's ACH account.

The type of ACH account the customer has.
Values: 'business' or 'personal'

The ACH account entity of the customer.
Values: 'checking' or 'savings'
Card billing country. Country codes are as shown in ISO 3166. Format: CC
You can pass custom information in up to 20 fields. Format: merchant_defined_field_1=Value

request.description: The Payment API allows integrators to utilize various different payment parameters in order to perform different transaction processes. The below request utilizes the most simplistic use of the Payment API in order to complete a sales transaction with the use of raw payment data rather than the use of a tokenized method.

urlencoded.description:
The type of transaction to be processed.
Values: 'sale', 'auth', 'credit', 'validate', or 'offline'

Total amount to be charged. For validate, the amount must be omitted or set to 0.00.
Format: x.xx
Specifies a Customer Vault id. If not set, the payment gateway will randomly generate a Customer Vault id.
Billing id assigned to specific billing record. Billing id should be used when calling a Vault record with multiple billings added.

request.description: The Gateway's Customer Vault allows merchants to call onto stored customer records to perform additional transactions. The section below will provide additional details on how integrations may use certain parameters to perform Customer Vault initiated transactions.

urlencoded.description:
The type of transaction to be processed.
Values: 'sale', 'auth', 'credit', or 'validate'

Total amount to be charged. For validate, the amount must be omitted or set to 0.00.
Format: x.xx
The tokenized version of the customer's card or check information. This will be generated by Collect.js and is usable only once.
Card billing country. Country codes are as shown in ISO 3166. Format: CC
You can pass custom information in up to 20 fields. Format: merchant_defined_field_1=Value

request.description: Collect.js is a JavaScript framework that allows merchants to collect sensitive payment information from their customers without exposing their website to the sensitive information. The example below will demonstrate how to pass the Payment Token returned via Collect.js into a Payment API request.

urlencoded.description: The registered terminal ID. Provide on transaction types of sale, auth, credit and validate.

The type of response you wish to see returned. Set to 'synchronous' to wait for a final transaction ID. Set to 'asynchronous' to receive an async_status_guid value to poll against.
Default: 'synchronous'
Values: 'synchronous' or 'asynchronous'
Note: You must use the AsyncStatus API if you use 'asynchronous' processing. Please see 'Response Style Selection' above for more information. You can see an example of the response you'll get in the examples below.

The type of transaction to be processed.
Values: 'sale', 'auth', 'credit', or 'validate'

Total amount to be charged. For validate, the amount must be omitted or set to 0.00.
Format: x.xx
Card billing country. Country codes are as shown in ISO 3166. Format: CC
You can pass custom information in up to 20 fields. Format: merchant_defined_field_1=Value

request.description: Customer-Present Cloud is a method of processing retail payments using an internet connected terminal without the use of an installed SDK. Integrators will utilize Customer-Present Cloud in conjunction with the Payment API in order to perform transactional operations.

item.description: This section will provide information on performing real use examples of specified transactional operations.

item.name: Gateway.js Examples

urlencoded.description:
The type of transaction to be processed.
Values: 'sale', 'auth', 'credit', 'validate', or 'offline'
The tokenized version of the customer's card or check information. This will be generated by Collect.js and is usable only once.

Total amount to be charged. For validate, the amount must be omitted or set to 0.00.
Format: x.xx

Cardholder authentication verification value.
Format: base64 encoded

Directory Server Transaction ID. May be provided as part of 3DSecure 2.0 authentication.
Format: xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx
A number that indicates the result of the attempt to authenticate the cardholder. Values are dependent on the card brand.

Set 3D Secure condition. Value used to determine E-commerce indicator (ECI).
Values: 'verified' or 'attempted'

Card billing country.
Country codes are as shown in ISO 3166. Format: CC

request.description:
Gateway.js is a JavaScript library that allows merchants to customize their integration and add additional gateway services such as 3D Secure. This example below will demonstrate how to pass all the 3DS parameters returned via Gateway.js into a Payment API request.

For a full payment stack, integrators will first need to integrate Gateway.js in order to obtain and retrieve the 3DS data, which would be passed within the Payment API request.

urlencoded.description:
The type of transaction to be processed.
Values: 'sale', 'auth', 'credit', 'validate', or 'offline'
The tokenized version of the customer's card or check information. This will be generated by Collect.js and is usable only once.

Total amount to be charged. For validate, the amount must be omitted or set to 0.00.
Format: x.xx

A single use session ID used by Kount to link the transaction and Data Collector information together. This ID should be generated every time a payment form is loaded by the cardholder, and be random/unpredictable (do not use sequential IDs). This ID should not be reused within a 30 day period. This can be used with Collect.js or the Payment API when using the Kount DDC with Gateway.js.
Format: alphanumeric, 32 characters required

Card billing country.
Country codes are as shown in ISO 3166. Format: CC

request.description:
Gateway.js is a JavaScript library that allows merchants to customize their integration and add additional gateway services such as Kount. This example below will demonstrate how to pass the Kount session id parameter returned via Gateway.js into a Payment API request.

Within a real world use case integrators will first need to integrate Gateway.js in order to retrieve the Kount session id in order to be passed within the Payment API request.

item.description: Gateway.js is a JavaScript library that allows merchants to customize their integration and add additional gateway services such as 3D Secure and Kount. Gateway.js works in conjunction with the Payment API in order to process transactions. With the use of Gateway.js, integrators may further secure their transactions by providing additional data from 3DS or the Kount Fraud Protector.

item.name: Customer Vault
Credential on File

urlencoded.description:
Add/Update a secure Customer Vault record.

Values: 'add_customer' or 'update_customer'
Specifies a Customer Vault id. If not set, the payment gateway will randomly generate a Customer Vault id.
The tokenized version of the customer's card or check information. This will be generated by Collect.js and is usable only once.

The type of transaction to be processed.

Values: 'sale', 'auth', 'credit', 'validate', or 'offline'

Total amount to be charged. For validate, the amount must be omitted or set to 0.00.

Format: x.xx

Who initiated the transaction.

Values: 'customer' or 'merchant'

Should be set to 'recurring' to mark payment as a recurring transaction or 'installment' to mark payment as an installment transaction.
Values: 'recurring', 'installment'

The indicator of the stored credential.

Values: 'stored' or 'used'

Use 'stored' when processing the initial transaction in which you are storing a customer's payment details (customer credentials) in the Customer Vault or other third-party payment storage system.

Use 'used' when processing a subsequent or follow-up transaction using the customer payment details (customer credentials) you have already stored to the Customer Vault or third-party payment storage method.

Cardholder authentication verification value.
Format: base64 encoded

Cardholder authentication transaction id.
Format: base64 encoded
A number that indicates the result of the attempt to authenticate the cardholder. Values are dependent on the card brand.

Set 3D Secure condition. Value used to determine E-commerce indicator (ECI).
Values: 'verified' or 'attempted'

Directory Server Transaction ID. May be provided as part of 3DSecure 2.0 authentication.
Format: xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx

request.description: Customer initiated transactions, also known as CIT, are Credential on File transactions in which customers are actively engaged in the checkout process. Typically this means customers will be physically present in a store, or checking out online in their browser.

urlencoded.description:
Add/Update a secure Customer Vault record.

Format: xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx

The type of transaction to be processed.

Values: 'sale', 'auth', 'credit', 'validate', or 'offline'

Should be set to 'recurring' to mark payment as a recurring transaction or 'installment' to mark payment as an installment transaction.

Who initiated the transaction.

Values: 'customer' or 'merchant'

The indicator of the stored credential.

Values: 'stored' or 'used'

Use 'stored' when processing the initial transaction in which you are storing a customer's payment details (customer credentials) in the Customer Vault or other third-party payment storage system.

Use 'used' when processing a subsequent or follow-up transaction using the customer payment details (customer credentials) you have already stored to the Customer Vault or third-party payment storage method.
Specifies a Customer Vault id. If not set, the payment gateway will randomly generate a Customer Vault id.

Cardholder authentication verification value.
Format: base64 encoded

Cardholder authentication transaction id.
Format: base64 encoded
A number that indicates the result of the attempt to authenticate the cardholder. Values are dependent on the card brand.

Set 3D Secure condition. Value used to determine E-commerce indicator (ECI).
Values: 'verified' or 'attempted'

Directory Server Transaction ID. May be provided as part of 3DSecure 2.0 authentication.
Format: xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx

The type of transaction to be processed.

Values: 'sale', 'auth', 'credit', 'validate', or 'offline'

Should be set to 'recurring' to mark payment as a recurring transaction or 'installment' to mark payment as an installment transaction.
Values: 'recurring', 'installment'

Who initiated the transaction.

Values: 'customer' or 'merchant'

The indicator of the stored credential.

Values: 'stored' or 'used'

Use 'stored' when processing the initial transaction in which you are storing a customer's payment details (customer credentials) in the Customer Vault or other third-party payment storage system.

Use 'used' when processing a subsequent or follow-up transaction using the customer payment details (customer credentials) you have already stored to the Customer Vault or third-party payment storage method.

Values: 'stored' or 'used'

Use 'stored' when processing the initial transaction in which you are storing a customer's payment details (customer credentials) in the Customer Vault or other third-party payment storage system.

Use 'used' when processing a subsequent or follow-up transaction using the customer payment details (customer credentials) you have already stored to the Customer Vault or third-party payment storage method.

The type of transaction to be processed.

Values: 'sale', 'auth', 'credit', 'validate', or 'offline'

Total amount to be charged. For validate, the amount must be omitted or set to 0.00.

Format: x.xx

request.description: Merchant initiated transactions, also known as MIT, are Credential on File transactions in which the customer isn’t actively engaged, but has given permission for their card to be charged. In order for a merchant to submit a Merchant Initiated Transaction, a Customer Initiated transaction is required first.

item.description:
Credential on File transactions should be used when storing any cardholder data to make payments at a later date. Credential on File is required to be used in locations which fall on the PSD2 Mandate and should be utilized any time a merchant hopes to store customer payment information.

Credential on File utilizes two different methods Customer Initiated Transactions or CIT and Merchant Initiated Transactions or MIT. Below will provide examples of what is needed in order to perform both a CIT and MIT transaction.

urlencoded.description:
Add/Update a secure Customer Vault record.

Values: 'add_customer' or 'update_customer'
Specifies a Customer Vault id. If not set, the payment gateway will randomly generate a Customer Vault id.
Shipping entry id. If none is provided, one will be created or the billing id with priority '1' will be updated.
Specifies a payment gateway transaction id in order to associate payment information with a Customer Vault record.

If set to true, credit card will be evaluated and sent based upon Automatic Card Updater settings. If set to false, credit card will not be submitted for updates when Automatic Card Updater runs.

Values: 'true' or 'false'

request.description: When utilizing the Customer Vault, integrators will have the ability to securely store their customer's payment data for future use. In order to do so, integrators will need to build out an add customer request and submit the request via the Payment API. Upon successful submission a new Customer Vault Id will be returned to signify that the Customer Vault Record has been created.

urlencoded.description:
Add/Update a secure Customer Vault record.

Values: 'add_customer' or 'update_customer'
Specifies a Customer Vault id. If not set, the payment gateway will randomly generate a Customer Vault id.
Shipping entry id. If none is provided, one will be created or the billing id with priority '1' will be updated.
Specifies a payment gateway transaction id in order to associate payment information with a Customer Vault record.

If set to true, credit card will be evaluated and sent based upon Automatic Card Updater settings. If set to false, credit card will not be submitted for updates when Automatic Card Updater runs.

Values: 'true' or 'false'

Add/Update a secure Customer Vault record.

Values: 'add_customer' or 'update_customer'
Specifies a Customer Vault id. If not set, the payment gateway will randomly generate a Customer Vault id.
If set, will perform a hybrid transaction while adding to the vault.
Needed if type is set to 'sale' or 'auth'
Shipping entry id. If none is provided, one will be created or the billing id with priority '1' will be updated.
Specifies a payment gateway transaction id in order to associate payment information with a Customer Vault record.

If set to true, credit card will be evaluated and sent based upon Automatic Card Updater settings. If set to false, credit card will not be submitted for updates when Automatic Card Updater runs.

Values: 'true' or 'false'

request.description: When utilizing the Customer Vault, integrators will have the ability to securely store their customer's payment data for future use. In order to do so, integrators will need to build out an add customer request and submit the request via the Payment API. Upon successful submission a new Customer Vault Id will be returned to signify that the Customer Vault Record has been created.

urlencoded.description:
Add/Update a secure Customer Vault record.

Values: 'add_customer' or 'update_customer'
Specifies a Customer Vault id. If not set, the payment gateway will randomly generate a Customer Vault id.
Shipping entry id. If none is provided, one will be created or the billing id with priority '1' will be updated.
Specifies a payment gateway transaction id in order to associate payment information with a Customer Vault record.

If set to true, credit card will be evaluated and sent based upon Automatic Card Updater settings. If set to false, credit card will not be submitted for updates when Automatic Card Updater runs.

Values: 'true' or 'false'

Add/Update a secure Customer Vault record.

Values: 'add_customer' or 'update_customer'
Specifies a Customer Vault id. If not set, the payment gateway will randomly generate a Customer Vault id.
Shipping entry id. If none is provided, one will be created or the billing id with priority '1' will be updated.
Specifies a payment gateway transaction id in order to associate payment information with a Customer Vault record.

If set to true, credit card will be evaluated and sent based upon Automatic Card Updater settings. If set to false, credit card will not be submitted for updates when Automatic Card Updater runs.

Values: 'true' or 'false'

request.description: Should any payment information/details change for a customer an Update request may be performed via the Payment API. This request will allow integrators to call a specified Customer Vault Record in order to change any details of the specific Vault Record. (ie Credit Card expiry, Name, Address, Credit Card Number...)

urlencoded.description:
Add/Update a secure Customer Vault record.

Values: 'add_customer' or 'update_customer'
Specifies a Customer Vault id. If not set, the payment gateway will randomly generate a Customer Vault id.
Shipping entry id. If none is provided, one will be created or the billing id with priority '1' will be updated.
Specifies a payment gateway transaction id in order to associate payment information with a Customer Vault record.

If set to true, credit card will be evaluated and sent based upon Automatic Card Updater settings. If set to false, credit card will not be submitted for updates when Automatic Card Updater runs.

Values: 'true' or 'false'

Deletes a secure Customer Vault record.
Values: 'delete_customer'

request.description: When utilizing the Customer Vault, integrators have the ability to delete a Customer Vault Record. Using the Payment API integrators may submit a delete customer request to remove a specified Customer Vault Record from the Customer Vault.

urlencoded.description:
Add/update a secure Customer Vault billing record.
Values: 'add_billing' or 'update_billing'

request.description: Each Customer Vault Record allows for multiple Billing Records to be stored within the Vault. These additional Billing Records may be added and stored within an already created Customer Vault Id. These additional Billing Records once created may then be used to perform payments should a `billing_id`be specified within the API request.

urlencoded.description:
Add/update a secure Customer Vault billing record.
Values: 'add_billing' or 'update_billing'

Add/update a secure Customer Vault billing record.
Values: 'add_billing' or 'update_billing'

request.description: Should any payment information/details change for a customer an Update request may be performed via the Payment API. This request will allow integrators to call a specified Customer Vault Billing Record in order to change any details to the specified Vault Billing Record. (ie Credit Card expiry, Name, Address, Credit Card Number...)

urlencoded.description:
Add/update a secure Customer Vault billing record.
Values: 'add_billing' or 'update_billing'

Deletes a secure Customer Vault billing record.

Values: 'delete_billing'

request.description: When utilizing the Customer Vault, integrators have the ability to delete a Billing Record from the Vault. Using the Payment API integrators may submit a delete billing request to remove a specified Billing Record.

item.description: The Customer Vault was designed specifically for businesses of any size to address concerns about handling customer payment information. The Customer Vault allows Merchants to securely store their customer's payment data within the Gateway's secure servers to be used for future transactional operations.

item.name: Recurring

urlencoded.description: Add a recurring plan that subscriptions can be added to in the future.

The number of payments before the recurring plan is complete.
Notes: '0' for until canceled

The plan amount to be charged each billing cycle.
Format: x.xx
The display name of the plan.
The unique plan ID that references only this recurring plan.
How often, in days, to charge the customer. Cannot be set with 'month_frequency' or 'day_of_month'.

How often, in months, to charge the customer. Cannot be set with 'day_frequency'. Must be set with 'day_of_month'.
Values: 1 through 24

The day that the customer will be charged. Cannot be set with 'day_frequency'. Must be set with 'month_frequency'.
Values: 1 through 31 - for months without 29, 30, or 31 days, the charge will be on the last day

request.description: Utilizing the add plan value for the recurring module allows integrations to create different plans. With these plans you may predefine the price and payment schedule for subscriptions tied to the plan.

urlencoded.description: Add a recurring plan that subscriptions can be added to in the future.

The number of payments before the recurring plan is complete.
Notes: '0' for until canceled

The plan amount to be charged each billing cycle.
Format: x.xx
The display name of the plan.
The unique plan ID that references only this recurring plan.
How often, in days, to charge the customer. Cannot be set with 'month_frequency' or 'day_of_month'.

How often, in months, to charge the customer. Cannot be set with 'day_frequency'. Must be set with 'day_of_month'.
Values: 1 through 24

The day that the customer will be charged. Cannot be set with 'day_frequency'. Must be set with 'month_frequency'.
Values: 1 through 31 - for months without 29, 30, or 31 days, the charge will be on the last day

Edit an existing recurring plan.
Value: 'edit_plan' - Be careful when editing an existing plan, as all customers signed up for this plan will have their billing changed based on your edits.
Only relevant for editing an existing plan, the value will be the 'plan_id' that will be edited in this request.

The number of payments before the recurring plan is complete.
Notes: '0' for until canceled

The plan amount to be charged each billing cycle.
Format: x.xx
The display name of the plan.
The unique plan ID that references only this recurring plan.
How often, in days, to charge the customer. Cannot be set with 'month_frequency' or 'day_of_month'.

How often, in months, to charge the customer. Cannot be set with 'day_frequency'. Must be set with 'day_of_month'.
Values: 1 through 24

The day that the customer will be charged. Cannot be set with 'day_frequency'. Must be set with 'month_frequency'.
Values: 1 through 31 - for months without 29, 30, or 31 days, the charge will be on the last day

request.description: With the recurring module, integrations may edit plans utilizing the Payment API. The edit function allows integrations to call a plan directly using the plan's id and make various changes to the plan. These changes may revolve around the pricing of the plan or changes to how often the plan will charge customers.

urlencoded.description:
Edit an existing recurring plan.
Value: 'edit_plan' - Be careful when editing an existing plan, as all customers signed up for this plan will have their billing changed based on your edits.
Only relevant for editing an existing plan, the value will be the 'plan_id' that will be edited in this request.

The number of payments before the recurring plan is complete.
Notes: '0' for until canceled

The plan amount to be charged each billing cycle.
Format: x.xx
The display name of the plan.
The unique plan ID that references only this recurring plan.
How often, in days, to charge the customer. Cannot be set with 'month_frequency' or 'day_of_month'.

How often, in months, to charge the customer. Cannot be set with 'day_frequency'. Must be set with 'day_of_month'.
Values: 1 through 24

The day that the customer will be charged. Cannot be set with 'day_frequency'. Must be set with 'month_frequency'.
Values: 1 through 31 - for months without 29, 30, or 31 days, the charge will be on the last day

item.name: Add a Subscription to an Existing Plan

urlencoded.description: Associate payment information with a recurring plan.
The plan ID of the plan that the subscription will be associated with.

The first day that the customer will be charged.
Format: YYYYMMDD
The tokenized version of the customer's card or check information. This will be generated by Collect.js and is usable only once.

The type of payment.
Default: 'creditcard'
Values: 'creditcard' or 'check'
The name on the customer's ACH account.

The customer's ACH account type.
Values: 'checking' or 'savings'

The customer's ACH account entity.
Values: 'personal' or 'business'

ACH standard entry class codes.
Values: 'PPD', 'WEB', 'TEL', or 'CCD'
Can be set up in merchant control panel under 'Settings'->'Merchant Defined Fields'.
If using Multiple MIDs, route to this processor (processor_id is obtained under Settings->Transaction Routing in the Control Panel).

If set to true, when the customer is charged, they will be sent a transaction receipt.
Values: 'true' or 'false'
Specifies a payment gateway transaction id in order to associate payment information with a Subscription record.

If set to true, credit card will be evaluated and sent based upon Automatic Card Updater settings. If set to false, credit card will not be submitted for updates when Automatic Card Updater runs.
Default: 'true'
Values: 'true' or 'false'

request.description: Once a merchant has created any plans they would like to offer to customers, merchants may now create subscriptions utilizing the predefined plans. Utilizing the Payment API integrations may utilize the plan id to link the plans payment details directly to a newly created subscription.

The customer's ACH account entity.
Values: 'personal' or 'business'

ACH standard entry class codes.
Values: 'PPD', 'WEB', 'TEL', or 'CCD'
Can be set up in merchant control panel under 'Settings'->'Merchant Defined Fields'.
If using Multiple MIDs, route to this processor (processor_id is obtained under Settings->Transaction Routing in the Control Panel).

If set to true, when the customer is charged, they will be sent a transaction receipt.
Values: 'true' or 'false'
Specifies a payment gateway transaction id in order to associate payment information with a Subscription record.

If set to true, credit card will be evaluated and sent based upon Automatic Card Updater settings. If set to false, credit card will not be submitted for updates when Automatic Card Updater runs.
Default: 'true'
Values: 'true' or 'false'

The number of payments before the recurring plan is complete.
Notes: '0' for until canceled

The plan amount to be charged each billing cycle.

How often, in days, to charge the customer. Cannot be set with 'month_frequency' or 'day_of_month'.

How often, in months, to charge the customer. Cannot be set with 'day_frequency'. Must be set with 'day_of_month'.
Values: 1 through 24

The day that the customer will be charged. Cannot be set with 'day_frequency'. Must be set with 'month_frequency'.
Values: 1 through 31 - for months without 29, 30, or 31 days, the charge will be on the last day

The first day that the customer will be charged.
Format: YYYYMMDD

The type of payment.
Default: 'creditcard'
Values: 'creditcard' or 'check'
The name on the customer's ACH account.

The customer's ACH account type.
Values: 'checking' or 'savings'

request.description: With the Gateway's recurring module, integrators may utilize the add subscription value for the recurring module in order to create custom subscriptions. These subscriptions are created per individual customer, unlike the plans. These custom subscriptions allow integrations to pass any payment schedules and price without having to link the subscription to any predefined plans.

request.description: When utilizing the recurring module's subscriptions, integrations may perform update requests via the Payment API in order to make changes to any already created subscriptions. Utilizing the subscription id returned at the time of subscription creation, integrations are able to call to a specified subscription and make changes to the recurring payments or customer's payment information.

request.description: With the recurring module, integrations have the ability to pause subscriptions. This means that the subscriptions will no longer run until unpaused. Utilizing the subscription's subscription id integrations may perform an API request which will pause any specified subscription indefinitely or until unpaused.

urlencoded.description: Delete the subscription. Customer will no longer be charged.
The subscription ID that will be deleted.

request.description: Subscriptions may be deleted via a Payment API request if requested within a Payment API request. Utilizing the Payment API delete requests may be performed. This is completed by providing the subscription's id along with the recurring parameter. Once the request is submitted any specified subscriptions will be removed from the Gateway and will no longer perform any recurring transactions.

item.description: The Payment API may be used to utilize NMI's recurring module. With the Payment API you may create different recurring plans. These plans may then be used to create predefined subscriptions for the merchant's customers. Additionally, the recurring module also allows integrations to create custom subscriptions. These subscriptions are not linked to any plans and are created once the Payment API request has been completed successfully.

item.name: Product Manager

urlencoded.description:
Add a product to the Product Manager.

Value: add_product, update_product, delete_product

The unique SKU for this product. An error will be returned if the SKU is already in use by another product. Must be alphanumeric.

Examples: 000001, SKU1

The user-facing name of the product.

Examples: "1 Gallon Milk" or "Phone Case"
The cost of the product before any tax or discounts. Must be greater than 0.00.

The currency for the product’s price.

Examples: "USD, GBP, EUR
The commodity code for the product.

The unit of measure for the product. Defaults to "NAR" (number of articles).

Examples: TDK or MTQ

The tax that should be added to the product cost. This is a fixed amount, not a percentage.

Example: 1.54
The discount that will subtracted from the cost of the product.
Required if adding an image. The Base64-encoded version of the image for the product. The format must be JPG, PNG, or GIF, and be 2MB or smaller.

Required if adding an image. The file name of the image being added with product_image_data.

Examples: product.png, sku-1234.jpg

request.description: When utilizing the Product Manager, integrators will have the ability to add multiple products to their Merchant Gateway Merchant Account. In order to do so, integrators will need to individually add the products by creating an add product request. Performing this request means integrators will only need to set up their product's information once in order to add the product to the Product Manager.

urlencoded.description:
Add a product to the Product Manager.

Value: add_product, update_product, delete_product

The unique SKU for this product. An error will be returned if the SKU is already in use by another product. Must be alphanumeric.

Examples: 000001, SKU1

The user-facing name of the product.

Examples: "1 Gallon Milk" or "Phone Case"
The cost of the product before any tax or discounts. Must be greater than 0.00.

The currency for the product’s price.

Examples: "USD, GBP, EUR
The commodity code for the product.

The unit of measure for the product. Defaults to "NAR" (number of articles).

Examples: TDK or MTQ

The tax that should be added to the product cost. This is a fixed amount, not a percentage.

Example: 1.54
The discount that will subtracted from the cost of the product.
Required if adding an image. The Base64-encoded version of the image for the product. The format must be JPG, PNG, or GIF, and be 2MB or smaller.

Required if adding an image. The file name of the image being added with product_image_data.

Examples: product.png, sku-1234.jpg

Add a product to the Product Manager.

Value: add_product, update_product, delete_product

The automatically generated ID for the product. This was returned in the add_product API response, or can be found in the UI under the Product Details page in the Product Manager.

Example: 5538585252

The unique SKU for this product. An error will be returned if the SKU is already in use by another product. Must be alphanumeric.

Examples: 000001, SKU1

The user-facing name of the product.

Examples: "1 Gallon Milk" or "Phone Case"
The cost of the product before any tax or discounts. Must be greater than 0.00.

The currency for the product’s price.

Examples: "USD, GBP, EUR
The commodity code for the product.

The unit of measure for the product. Defaults to "NAR" (number of articles).

Examples: TDK or MTQ

The tax that should be added to the product cost. This is a fixed amount, not a percentage.

Example: 1.54
The discount that will subtracted from the cost of the product.
Required if adding an image. The Base64-encoded version of the image for the product. The format must be JPG, PNG, or GIF, and be 2MB or smaller.

Required if adding an image. The file name of the image being added with product_image_data.

Examples: product.png, sku-1234.jpg

request.description: Should any product information/details change for an already created product, integrations may utilize an Update request. This request will allow integrators to call a specified product within the Product Manager in order to change details of the specified product. (ie SKU, Name, Amount, Commodity Code...)

urlencoded.description:
Add a product to the Product Manager.

Value: add_product, update_product, delete_product

The automatically generated ID for the product. This was returned in the add_product API response, or can be found in the UI under the Product Details page in the Product Manager.

Example: 5538585252

The unique SKU for this product. An error will be returned if the SKU is already in use by another product. Must be alphanumeric.

Examples: 000001, SKU1

The user-facing name of the product.

Examples: "1 Gallon Milk" or "Phone Case"
The cost of the product before any tax or discounts. Must be greater than 0.00.

The currency for the product’s price.

Examples: "USD, GBP, EUR
The commodity code for the product.

The unit of measure for the product. Defaults to "NAR" (number of articles).

Examples: TDK or MTQ

The tax that should be added to the product cost. This is a fixed amount, not a percentage.

Example: 1.54
The discount that will subtracted from the cost of the product.
Required if adding an image. The Base64-encoded version of the image for the product. The format must be JPG, PNG, or GIF, and be 2MB or smaller.

Required if adding an image. The file name of the image being added with product_image_data.

Examples: product.png, sku-1234.jpg

Add a product to the Product Manager.

Value: add_product, update_product, delete_product

The automatically generated ID for the product. This was returned in the add_product API response, or can be found in the UI under the Product Details page in the Product Manager.

Example: 5538585252

request.description: When utilizing the Product Manager, integrators have the ability to delete any product via a Payment API request. When utilizing the API, integrators may submit a delete product request to remove a specified product directly from the Product Manager.

item.description: The Gateway's Product Manager is a service within the Gateway which allows users to create, update and delete preset products within the Merchant Gateway Account. This service allows merchant's to to define these products by allowing merchants to set the products SKU, descriptions and pricings.

item.name: Invoicing

urlencoded.description: Create a new invoice and email it to the customer.
Total amount to be invoiced. Must be greater than 0.00.
Billing email address, an invoice will be sent to this address when it is created.
When the invoice should be paid. Values: 'upon_receipt', or integers from 0-999.

What payment methods a customer may use when paying invoice. 
Values: 'cc', 'ck', and 'cs'.
If using Multiple MIDs, route to this processor (processor_id is obtained under Settings → Transaction Routing in the Control Panel).

Card billing country. Country codes are as shown in ISO 3166. 
Format: CC

You can pass custom information in up to 20 fields. 
Format: merchant_defined_field_1=Value

request.description: Utilizing the Payment API, integrators may build requests to create and set up invoices. Within these requests integrators will also need to provide the customer's email as upon the creation of the invoice, an email invoice will be sent directly to the email provided within the request.

urlencoded.description: Create a new invoice and email it to the customer.
The invoice ID to be updated.
Total amount to be invoiced. Must be greater than 0.00.
Billing email address, an invoice will be sent to this address when it is created.
When the invoice should be paid. Values: 'upon_receipt', or integers from 0-999.

What payment methods a customer may use when paying invoice. 
Values: 'cc', 'ck', and 'cs'.
If using Multiple MIDs, route to this processor (processor_id is obtained under Settings → Transaction Routing in the Control Panel).

Card billing country. Country codes are as shown in ISO 3166. 
Format: CC

You can pass custom information in up to 20 fields. 
Format: merchant_defined_field_1=Value

request.description: Should any information/details need to be changed for an invoice, integrators may perform an update request via the Payment API. This request will allow integrators to call a specific invoice utilizing the invoice's id in order to change any details of the specified Invoice. (ie Amount, Name, Address, Payment Date...)

urlencoded.description: Send an existing invoice to a customer.
The invoice ID to be emailed.

request.description: When utilizing the Gateway's invoice system integrations will have the ability to resend any invoices. In many cases customer's or merchants may need/want an invoice to be emailed again, utilizing the Payment API integrations may do this by providing an email and an invoice id within the API request.

urlencoded.description: The invoice ID to be closed.

request.description: When utilizing Invoicing, integrators have the ability to close any open invoices. Using the Payment API integrators may submit a close invoice request to mark a specified invoice as closed.

item.description: The Gateway's Invoice system is a service within the Gateway which allows users to create, update, send and delete invoices within the Merchant Gateway Account. This service allows merchant's to prepare invoices through the Payment API directly, along with this, the service allows merchants to email invoices directly to customers.
